question: Target lesions are seen in following type of drug reactions?
What is the term for when a chromosome divides along an axis perpendicular to its normal axis of division?
Which of the following enzymes is deficient in homocystinuria?
Which of the following procedures is a cosmetic procedure for the eyelids?

A 42-year-old female presents to the dermatology clinic with complaints of itching on her elbows and knees for the past two days. Her past medical record is significant for celiac disease which was diagnosed 1 year ago. On examination, grouped erythematous vesicles are appreciated on elbows and knees. Direct immunofluorescence of the skin biopsy is likely to show which of the following?

answers.option: Linear deposition of the complement at the dermoepidermal junction
Deposition of immunoglobulin along the plasma membrane of the keratinocyte
Deposits of IgA at the tip of dermal papillae
Deposits of IgG at the tip of dermal pappilae
A fishnet pattern of immunoglobulin deposition along with suprabasal acantholysis

question: A 17-year-old male presents in the emergency department after suffering a burn injury. On initial examination, the man appears to be breathing with difficulty and his heart rate is increased. Which of the following steps must be taken in the initial management of this patient?

A student is observing a skin biopsy slide in the pathology lab, he notices suprabasal acantholysis along with tomb-like deposition of the antibodies. Antibodies are directed against which of the following in this disease?
Which of the following phenomena is commonly exhibited by Down syndrome?
Which of the following is the most common type of amputation?
The Malpighian layer in the skin is comprised of which layers?

A pregnant female come to her gynecologist and told her about the history of hemophilia in her family. She asked the doctor about the chance of presence of this disease in her child. The doctor calculated the risk and told her that it will be which of the following?
Which of the following is the most common side effect of methotrexate?

A 32-year-old male presents to the emergency department after he suffered burn injuries. On initial assessment, around 30% of the total body surface area seems to have burned. Which of the following is the first step in the management of this patient?
Which of the following is the most used orthosis in clinical practice?
What is the disadvantage of an upper limb prosthesis powered by an electric motor?
While managing an amputee regarding stump, which of the following is the ideal shape?
What is the mode of action of fluconazole?

A histopathology specimen shows basaloid cells containing ducts that fit together like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle. The sample was taken from a nodular lesion on the scalp. What is the likely diagnosis?
What is the term used to describe a change in the frequency of an existing gene variant in the population due to random chance?
Which one of the following is the smallest unit of genetic material that can produce a phenotypic effect on mutation?

An elderly lady presents to the clinic with a history of a long-standing ulcer on her scalp that has been growing slowly for the past 18 months. The ulcer has raised, rolled edges, and is not healing. Which of the following is most likely to be seen in the biopsy of the lesion?

answers.option: Invasive groups of squamous cells with keratin pearl formation
Nests of basaloid cells with peripheral palisading
Clusters of nevus cells in the dermis

question: A hemophilic man marries a non-hemophilic woman, homozygous for the trait. What is the possibility that their child may have hemophilia?

A 66-year-old elderly male, known case of diabetes, presents to the clinic with the complaint of 2-3 erythematous crusted lesions on his lower shins for 1 week. The lesions have an edematous base and the crust is thickly adherent. Removal of a crust causes pain and reveals an underlying shallow ulcer. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 6-year-old school-going girl comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of intense itching of scalp for 1 month. No one else in her family has this complaint. There are a few pruritic papules present on the nape of her neck and multiple nits are noted on her hair shafts. What is the duration of time after which the treatment for her condition needs to be repeated?

A 30-year-old male, a known case of severe rheumatoid arthritis, presents to the clinic with the complaint of severe itching throughout the body for 2 weeks. On examination, he has large warty crusts on his hands and feet with thickening and fissuring of palms and soles. His nails are thickened and discolored. Skin biopsy shows no fungal organisms. He has been taking systemic steroids for his rheumatoid arthritis. The severity of itchiness is increasing over time. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A single recessive trait will be able to express its influence when it is present on which of the following chromosomes?

A 36-year-old man presents with swollen, painful heels, nail changes, and left lower back pain that wakes him up from sleep. The back pain gets better with exercise. He reports 1 to 2 hours of morning stiffness. He also has a history of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis since he was 12 years old. It is decided to change his current regimen of indomethacin to a biologic that is a cluster of differentiation-2 (CD-2) receptor antagonist used in the treatment of psoriasis. Which of the following drugs is prescribed to him?

A 36-year-old male presents with swollen, painful heels, and left lower back pain that wakes him up from sleep. The back pain gets better with exercise. He reports 1 to 2 hours of morning stiffness. He also has a history of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis since he was 12 years old. It is decided to change his current regimen of indomethacin to a biologic that targets tumor necrosis factor (TNF-α). Which of the following is a chimeric monoclonal antibody that binds to TNF-α and inhibits its action?
Which of the following conditions is true for phenylketonuria?

answers.option: It is an autosomal recessive trait associated with mental retardation
It is an autosomal recessive trait associated with rudimentary ovaries in females
It is an autosomal trisomy associated with mongolism
It is an X-linked recessive trait associated with mental retardation
It is an autosomal dominant trait associated with gynecomastia

question: How is it possible that males with a sickness die invariably, but the trait persists in the population?

answers.option: Some males have it recessively and consequently pass it on to their offsprings
One-half of each male and female child inherits the trait and acts as a carrier
Moms pass it on to one-half of their daughters, who serve as carriers

question: A pregnant woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of generalized itching, aggravated at night, for 7 days. Family history is also positive for itching. On examination, she has papules, excoriations, and burrows on her skin. What is the treatment for her condition?
Which of the following cells are involved in the first line of defense in the skin against any pathogen?

A family of four presents to the clinic with the complaint of increasing nocturnal itching. There are excoriation marks on their limbs and trunk. Using a magnifying glass, a few tunnel-shaped lesions can be identified in the web spaces of their fingers. What is another sign that can aid in the diagnosis of this condition?

A 24-hour-old baby girl, who was born at Queen Elizabeth Hospital, UK, in July 2023, went for a complete medical checkup before she was discharged from the hospital. Her blood reports were normal, but genetic testing revealed three people's genetic sequences. Her parents had had 4 miscarriages before she was born. What was the most likely reason for having three people's genetic sequences?

answers.option: The baby was born by using the healthy donor mitochondrial gene
Her father was born through in-vitro fertilization (IVF)
The baby had mitochondrial disease because of in-vitro fertilization (IVF)
Her parents had a family history of hemophilia
Her mother was born through in-vitro fertilization (IVF)

question: A 35-year-old couple visited a tertiary care hospital in Lalkurti, Rawalpindi. They were cousins by relation. Upon clinical history, the wife's hemoglobin was 7 g/dl and she had an enlarged spleen. Her gallbladder was removed a few months ago. She had had multiple abortions. She also looked pale and anemic. Upon genetic analysis, she was diagnosed with beta-thalassemia. What is the most likely reason for having this genetic abnormality?
What is the karyotype of Patau syndrome?
Which chromosomal abnormality occurs when a chromosome divides along the axis perpendicular to its normal axis of division?
According to the classification of burns, the burnt area which shows blisters filled with clear fluid and is very tender to touch falls under which category?

answers.option: Cannot be assessed on physical examination

question: A 60-year-old female comes to a primary health clinic. She complains of intense itching over her entire body, especially at night, for the last 1 week. On examination, she has a pimple-like rash on her wrists, armpits, abdomen, and buttocks. There are sores on the body caused by scratching. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old man has a road traffic accident and injures his right leg. He has an open fracture, with viable muscles and about a 3 cm exposed fracture site. The orthopedic surgeon plans to fix the fracture and calls the plastic surgeon for reconstruction. What is the best option to reconstruct this injury?

A 26-year-old patient sustained a mixed-thickness burn, 2 hours back, involving the anterior chest, abdomen, and both thighs. The total body surface area of the burn is 25% and the weight of the patient is 50 kg. What will be his fluid requirement for the next 8 hours?

answers.option: 5000 ml of crystalloid along with colloid
2500 ml of Ringer's lactate along with replenishing insensible loss
1250 in first 8 hours and adjust according to urine output

question: All of the statements are true regarding prosthesis, except which one of the following?

answers.option: It is usually used to replace parts lost by injury
It is an externally applied device used to modify structural and functional characteristics of neuromuscular and skeletal system
It is used to restore the mobility of an amputee
It is an artificial extension replacing missing body part

question: An 8-year-old boy presents to the clinic with an extremely itchy rash for the past 2 days. He is the fourth student in his class to present with the same symptom. The rash is across his hands, wrists, and elbows bilaterally. Small erythematous papules with obvious burrows, looking like insect bites, aligned in 8 cm segments are seen on examination. What is the most appropriate treatment?

A 56-year-old female with diabetes presents for a routine foot evaluation with her podiatrist. The patient complains of thickening of the right big toenail and a color change (yellow). The podiatrist diagnoses the patient with onychomycosis of the toenails. Which of the following is the most appropriate choice of treatment for this infection?

'Any loss or abnormality of anatomical, physiological, or psychological structure or function which results from abnormalities of body structure, appearance, organ, or system function.' Which of the following terms best corresponds to this definition?

A 72-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with the complaint that she has noticed changes in one of the moles on her arm. It has become larger and the color has changed from a uniform brown to a mottled brown with blackish areas. The borders are irregular and it also itches and bleeds sometimes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A lady sustains a flame burn to the body with 58% total body surface burn. She survives the initial ebb phase of the cycle and now requires wound coverage on her thighs, back, and scalp. What would be the best option to cover her wounds with?
According to the four-color code system, what color are moribund patients assigned in case of a disaster?

A female athlete comes to the clinic with complaints of reduction in breast size, falling of hair, increased facial hair, and being very aggressive and anxious lately. On examination, the patient has a muscular build, signs of breast atrophy, hirsutism, and acne on the face. Which of the following drugs is she most probably abusing?

A 22-year-old medical student presents with the complaint of having developed a new pigmented lesion on his arm. Examination reveals a well-circumscribed, uniformly dark-brown, slightly raised lesion measuring 4 mm in diameter. A biopsy reveals groups and clusters of pigmented nevus cells at the dermo-epidermal junction and in the dermis. Which of the following nevi does he most likely have?

A lady brings her 8-year-old daughter to the clinic saying that the child has developed multiple, small, rounded, hyperpigmented lesions on her nose and cheeks. The lesions get darker when she plays outside. On examination, the lesions are flat, brown, and multiple, and measure about 1-2 mm in diameter. A biopsy is performed and shows increased amounts of melanin pigment within basal keratinocytes. The density of melanocytes is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 16-year-old hirsute girl comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of a few bumps scattered symmetrically on her lower legs that developed 1 week after shaving. Initially, the lesions were tiny but now they are slightly raised, red papules. There is no associated pain, itching, or discharge. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A Karachi Electric line man sustained a flash burn to the neck and face and a high-voltage electric burn. He had an entry wound in his left palm and an exit from his left foot. He lost consciousness after the injury, but now his Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score is 14/15. He is now in emergency room, what will be the first step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Assess total body surface area burn
Call the anesthetist for elective intubation
Start ATLS protocol and activate the trauma team

question: What is the first step in the management of the burning process?

A 10-year-old girl with congenital melanocytic nevus on her right lower face had nevus excision and reconstruction with full-thickness graft 2 years back. Her parents bring her to the clinic with scarring and deformed lower face. Which of the following is the best plan in management of this patient?

answers.option: Reassure that it will settle over time

answers.option: Posterior dislocation of ulna is present on examination
It is an acute lesion which resolves within a week
It occurs during backhand stroke while playing tennis
It does not affect hand grip
It presents with pain and tenderness over medial epicondyle

question: In which of the following inheritance patterns, males and females are equally affected in all generations?

A 5-year-old boy presents with generalized itching all over the body. On examination, there are excoriated papules and pustules over the genitals, fingers, and interdigital areas. What is his most appropriate treatment?
A female presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of acne and excessive hair growth. On examination, she is obese. She has a history of menstrual abnormalities. What is her diagnosis?

A burn patient is brought to the emergency department. On examination, the skin is leathery, and no bleeding or blisters are visible. He has a little pain in the burn area. Which of the following categories does this burn belong to?
Which of the following is the most common site of amputation?
What are antigen-presenting cells of the skin?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of blisters on the skin and mucous membranes. On examination, blisters are acantholytic and Nikolsky's sign is positive. Which of the following is used as a confirmatory test?

answers.option: Skin immunofluorescence with anti-IgG and IgA antibodies

question: The students of the fourth year are given a form with a question about how they feel about 4th year and they can answer freely about it. What type of question it is?
A patient presents with pigmentation under the nail and palpable axillary lymph nodes. Excision biopsy is indicated. What will be the differential diagnosis based on the clinical presentation?

A middle-aged farmer came to the clinic with a mass in the inner canthus of his eye. This mass was surgically removed and histologically diagnosed as basal cell carcinoma (BCC). Which of the following characteristics indicates a high-risk BCC?

answers.option: The tumor present on the trunk
Tumor with no recurrence before but now has recurrence

question: A 30-year-old woman comes for a routine evaluation. She gives a history of tiredness and weight gain. On examination, she has dry, coarse skin, and thickened plaques on her lower leg. Her pulse is 70/minute. Investigations show TSH 22 mIU/L and free T4 0.5 ng/mL. What is the most likely cause of her weight gain?

An 82-year-old man presented with a 1.2 x 0.7 cm nodular dichromic lesion on the scalp. The patient’s personal medical history was unremarkable. Which positive immune stain would confirm the diagnosis of invasive melanoma?

Which of the following disorders is characterized by CAG repeats?

A 45-year-old man with transtibial amputation came to amputee clinic for a functional prosthesis. Which of these is the most commonly prescribed foot?

Which of the following theories is commonly accepted as the mechanism of action of transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS)?
Which one of the following is the most specific test for carpal tunnel syndrome?
Which of the following is the most frequently asked question by parents of a child affected with cerebral palsy?

answers.option: Will my child ever be able to study in school?

question: A middle-aged female presented to her gynecologist for irregular menstruation, hirsutism, and acne. She has used so many oral as well as topical antibiotics for acne but the condition is the same. What is the best treatment in this case?

answers.option: Heavy dose oral broad spectrum antibiotics for a long period

question: A 55-year-old female presents to the hospital with shortness of breath, fever, and malaise. She has a history of breast cancer which was diagnosed 3 months ago and has been treated with chemotherapy. Her chest X-ray (CXR) shows signs of possible pneumonia and respiratory cultures are positive for Aspergillus fumigatus. Which of the following is the most appropriate choice of treatment?

A 65-year-old male presents to the hospital with shortness of breath and cardiac illness. Which of the following antifungal agents should be avoided in patients with evidence of ventricular dysfunction?

A 16-year-old boy visited the skin clinic with a complaint of gradual hair loss for 3 months. On examination, he had greasy yellow fine scales on the scalp associated with an itchy erythematous scaly rash on eyebrows, nasolabial fold, upper chest, and back. What is the clinical diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic complaining that she has been dropping things frequently from her hands for the past few months. This has become quite annoying for her as it is interfering with her daily activities. She also complains of decreased sensation in the middle and index fingers. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which provocative test is used for lateral epicondylitis?
A 25-year-old patient has been prescribed ultrasound therapy to control the pain due to de Quervain tenosynovitis. Which of the following is a contraindication of this therapy?

answers.option: Abductor pollicis longus and extensor pollicis brevis
Extensor pollicis and abductor pollicis brevis
Flexor carpi ulnaris and abductor pollicis longus
Extensor carpi radialis and abductor pollicis longus
Extensor pollicis longus and abductor pollicis longus

A 63-year-old male presents with right-sided paralysis following a stroke. What is the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of impairments and disabilities?
During history taking and examination in physical medicine and rehabilitation, what is/are the main aspect/s focused on by a physiatrist?

answers.option: Functional aspect of history and examination

question: Following a road traffic accident, a 35-year-old male's right leg is amputated below the knee at the middle of the leg. What is the most appropriate prosthesis for this patient?
Which of the following is the least important consideration when choosing an upper limb prosthesis?
Which of the following is not a clinical feature of orthoses?

Some types of single-gene disorders occur in individuals with a single mutated copy of the gene, and a single non-mutated allele is not enough to prevent the disease. Which pattern of inheritance best describes this disorder?
